publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7698 Sandra White: Celtic Connections 2011—That the Parliament welcomes the return of what is considered Glasgow’s world-class Celtic Connections festival as it celebrates its 18th anniversary in real style with more than 1,500 artists performing 300 events from 13 to 30 January in venues across Glasgow; considers that, since its inception, the festival has grown to become truly global in its outlook, with an eclectic mix of musical genres fusing around bold Celtic harmonies while showcasing Glasgow as a rich, diverse and exciting city to visit; further notes that, every year, the festival’s educational programme provides thousands of Scottish schoolchildren with the opportunity to experience and enjoy their cultural heritage through free schools concerts and in-school workshops, which, it considers, has benefitted over 170,000 children from all over Scotland since 1999, including pupils from over 70% of schools in Glasgow, and congratulates all those involved in delivering such a world-class event. The member has provided the following Gaelic translation: Celtic Connections 2011 Gu bheil a’ Phàrlamaid a’ cur fàilte air ais air Celtic Connections, sàr fhèis ciùil Ghlaschu ‘s i a’ comharrachadh ochd bliadhna deug, le còrr is 1,500 luchd-ciùil a’ cluich aig 300 tachartasan air feadh Ghlaschu eadar 13 agus 30 Faoilleach; ag aithneachadh gu bheil an fhèis air fàs gu bhith cruinneil na feallsanachd le measgachadh de sheòrsaichean ciùil a’ tighinn còmhla an lùib fuinn ceòlmhor Ceilteach agus gu bheil seo a’ daingneachadh na h-inbhe a th’ aig Glaschu mar bhaile a tha ioma-fhillte le beartas chultaran; cuideachd a’ mothachadh gu bheil prògram foghlaim na fèis a’ toirt cothrom do mhìltean de chlann sgoile ann an Alba blasad air an cuid dualchas fhèin tro chonsairtean agus bùthan-obrach; tha seo air a bhith na bhuannachd do chòrr is 170,000 clann-sgoile bho air feadh na h-Alba bho 1999, nam measg clann sgoile bho còrr is 70% de sgoiltean Ghlaschu agus thathar a’ cur meal-a-naidheachd air gach duine a tha a’ sàs ann a bhith a’ toirt an tachartais seo gu buil. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Rob Gibson*, Alasdair Allan*, Stuart McMillan*, Tricia Marwick*, Jamie McGrigor*, Kenneth Gibson*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Stewart Maxwell*, Anne McLaughlin*, Brian Adam*, Ken Macintosh*, Maureen Watt*, Willie Coffey*
